page.title: 04Old Court Nurseries, Colwall
page.content: These nurseries, situated in Colwall, are owned and run by Paul and Meriel Picton. On 0.7 of a hectare they specialise in unusual hardy perennials and Michaelmas Daisies- they sell 40 varieties of these out of a total of only 200 in existence. Publicity for the nurseries is entirely by 'word of mouth', and keen gardeners come from afar to see the selection available. The unusual plants include Onosma, a member of the borage family, dwarf Daphnes, and hardy Geraniums. Over 80% of Michaelmas Daisies have double flowers, yet the first ever double was developed here in 1901 and is called 'Beauty of Colwall'. Owing to the delicate nature of the plants, much of the relatively small nursery is, in fact, taken up with greenhouses.
